snippet: You have 10-4-3 of clubs in the dummy opposite A-J-5-2 in your hand. You need two winners from this suit but can afford to lose only one trick. Assuming you have no entry concerns, what will you do?
lead_paragraph: You have 10-4-3 of clubs in the dummy opposite A-J-5-2 in your hand. You need two winners from this suit but can afford to lose only one trick. Assuming you have no entry concerns, what will you do?

headline.main: Anticipating a Defensive Error Costs Dearly
